meanings.definition: The projecting nose and mouth of an animal, especially a mammal.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's snouts were wet from sniffing around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The pig used its snouts to dig in the mud for food.
meanings.sent3: The curious snouts of the raccoons poked out from behind the bushes.
meanings.sent4: The snouts of the elephants reached out to grab the leaves from the trees.
meanings.sent5: The snouts of the dogs twitched as they caught a whiff of something delicious nearby.

meanings.definition: The front end of a gun barrel.
meanings.sent1: The soldier carefully cleaned the snouts of his rifle after training.
meanings.sent2: The detective examined the snouts of the guns found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy's snouts gleamed in the sunlight as he prepared for the duel.
meanings.sent4: The snouts of the cannons pointed towards the enemy ships on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The snouts of the rifles were polished to a shine for the parade.

meanings.definition: A nozzle or spout for directing a flow of liquid.
meanings.sent1: The gardener attached a snouts to the hose for watering the plants.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic replaced the snouts of the oil dispenser in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The fountain's snouts sprayed water in all directions, delighting the children.
meanings.sent4: The snouts of the watering can helped to reach the hanging plants.
meanings.sent5: The snouts of the teapot poured out steaming hot tea into the cups.
